definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful

sentences.english: The gardener told me that the florescence of flowers varies by floral variety.
sentences.chinese: 花把势告诉我们花的品种不一样，花期也就不同。

definition: flowery of fist with fancy footwork (idiom)/highly embellished and ineffectual/fancy but impractical skills/all show and no go/pugilistic wankery
showy boxing of no practical use/see 花拳繡腿|花拳绣腿
to do sth for show/to keep up appearances
a couple of times/to repeat the same/the same old trick/tricks of the trade
to put on airs/to adopt a false attitude
variant of 打把勢|打把势[da3 ba3 shi5]
lit. to arrange a shelf of flowers/superficial display (idiom)
silvery spear point actually made of pewter (idiom); fig. worthless despite an attractive exterior
